title: China’s Antigraft Watchdog Probes Former CEO of China Merchants Bank
sub_head: Tian Huiyu was removed from the helm of the lender on Monday
body:
China’s anticorruption watchdog said it has placed the former president and chief executive of China Merchants Bank Co. under an investigation, just days after he was abruptly removed from the helm of the state-backed lender.
The country’s Central Commission for Discipline Inspection said in a brief statement on Friday that Tian Huiyu is “suspected of seriously violating discipline and laws,” without providing details.
